conclusion: Analyze the flow path of liquid from top containers through baffles to determine which bottom container will collect the liquid
Four starting positions (A, B, C, and D) at the top where liquid will be released
Multiple baffle sticks arranged diagonally in the middle section
Two potential collection containers (E and F) at the bottom
Liquid drops from A
Liquid from A will first encounter the yellow diagonal baffle pointing downward to the left
Following the yellow baffle, liquid from A will be directed toward the left side
Liquid from A will likely continue toward the leftmost house-shaped structure (E)
Liquid drops from B
Liquid from B will encounter the brown diagonal baffle pointing downward to the right
Redirection from brown baffle will point liquid from B toward the center-right
Liquid from B will likely encounter the white baffle
Following these paths, liquid from B appears to be directed toward the right side
Liquid from B will flow toward container F
Liquid drops from C
Liquid from C will first encounter the gray diagonal baffle pointing downward to the right
Gray baffle will direct liquid from C toward the right side
Following this path, liquid from C will likely end up in container F
Liquid drops from D
Liquid from D may not directly hit any visible baffles in its initial path
Based on starting position far to the right, liquid from D will naturally flow toward the right side
Liquid from D will end up in container F
Liquid from container A will flow into container E
Liquid from containers B, C, and D will flow into container F
